intro: Keckiella antirrhinoides subsp. microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved keckiella, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has small, narrow leaves that are densely arranged along the stems. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and are clustered in racemes, contributing to its ornamental value. The subspecies is distinguished by its reduced leaf size compared to other members of the species.
